intro: Cyrtandra todaiensis, commonly known as the Todai Island Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Todai in the Philippines. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
